actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide families with estate tax relief, and for other purposes.
short_title: Family Estate Tax Relief Act of 1997

summary.text: Family Estate Tax Relief Act of 1997 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide for an annual incremental increase, from the current $192,800 credit to a credit of $1 million by the year 2004, in the credit against the estate transfer tax. Excludes from the value of the gross estate, in specified circumstances, the lesser of: (1) the adjusted value of the qualified family-owned business interests of the decedent otherwise includible in the estate; or (2) $1 million, reduced by the amount of an exclusion allowed with respect to the estate of a previously deceased spouse of the decendent. Increases the portion of the estate tax subject to the four-percent interest rate applicable to an extended estate tax payment time where the estate consists largely of a closely held business.

titles.title: Family Estate Tax Relief Act of 1997
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide families with estate tax relief, and for other purposes.
